fusilli.fusionmodels.tabularimagefusion.concat_img_latent_tab_doubletrainïƒ

Concatenating the latent img space and tabular data. The latent image space is trained separately from both the tabular data and the labels, using the img_latent_subspace_method class.

Classes

ConcatImgLatentTabDoubleTrain(pred_type,Â ...)

Concatenating the latent img space and tabular data.

ImgLatentSpace(data_dims)

Pytorch lightning module: autoencoder to train the latent image space.

concat_img_latent_tab_subspace_method(datamodule)

Class containing the method to train the latent image space and to convert the image data to the latent image space.
class ConcatImgLatentTabDoubleTrain(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Concatenating the latent img space and tabular data. The latent image space is trained separately from both the tabular data and the labels, using the img_latent_subspace_method class.

pred_typeïƒ

Type of prediction to be performed.

Type:

str

latent_dimïƒ

Dimension of the latent image space once we encode it down. Taken from the subspace_method class and inferred from the dimensions of the input data to the model.

Type:

int

enc_img_layerïƒ

Linear layer to reduce the dimension of the latent image space. Calculated with calc_fused_layers().

Type:

nn.Linear

fused_dimïƒ

Dimension of the fused layers. Calculated with calc_fused_layers().

Type:

int

fused_layersïƒ

Sequential layer containing the fused layers. Calculated with calc_fused_layers().

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_predictionïƒ

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers. The final prediction layers take in the number of features of the fused layers as input. Calculated with calc_fused_layers().

Type:

nn.Sequential

__init__(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • pred_type (str) â€“ Type of prediction to be performed.

  • data_dims (list) â€“ Dictionary containing the dimensions of the data.

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary containing the parameters of the model.

calc_fused_layers()[source]ïƒ

Calculate the fused layers. If layer sizes are modified, this function will be called again to adjust the fused layers.

Return type:

None

Forward pass of the model.

Parameters:

x (tuple) â€“ Tuple containing the input data. First element is the tabular data, second element is the image data from the image subspace method.

Returns:

List containing the output of the model.

Return type:

class ImgLatentSpace(data_dims)[source]ïƒ

Bases: LightningModule

Pytorch lightning module: autoencoder to train the latent image space.

data_dimsïƒ

Dictionary containing the dimensions of the data.

Type:

dict

img_dimïƒ

Dimensions of the image data.

Type:

tuple

latent_dimïƒ

Dimension of the latent image space once we encode it down. Default is 64.

Type:

int

encoderïƒ

Sequential layer containing the encoder layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

decoderïƒ

Sequential layer containing the decoder layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

new_encoderïƒ

Sequential layer containing the encoder layers and the linear layer to reduce the dimension of the latent image space. Calculated with calc_fused_layers().

Type:

nn.Sequential

new_decoderïƒ

Sequential layer containing the decoder layers and the linear layer to increase the dimension of the latent image space. Calculated with calc_fused_layers().

Type:

nn.Sequential

class concat_img_latent_tab_subspace_method(datamodule, k=None, max_epochs=1000, train_subspace=True)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

Class containing the method to train the latent image space and to convert the image data to the latent image space.

datamoduleïƒ

Data module containing the data.

Type:

pl.LightningDataModule

trainerïƒ

Lightning trainer.

Type:

pytorch_lightning.Trainer

autoencoderïƒ

Autoencoder to train the latent image space.

Type:

ImgLatentSpace

__init__(datamodule, k=None, max_epochs=1000, train_subspace=True)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • datamodule (class) â€“ Data module containing the data.

  • k (int or None) â€“ Number of folds for cross validation. Default is None.

  • max_epochs (int) â€“ Maximum number of epochs to train the latent image space.

  • train_subspace (bool) â€“ Whether to train the latent image space or not. Default is True. If False, a new trainer will not be created. Then load_ckpt() must be called to load the checkpoint of the latent image space.

convert_to_latent(test_dataset)[source]ïƒ

Returns:

  • pd.DataFrame â€“ Dataframe containing the labels.

  • list â€“ List containing the dimensions of the data.

load_ckpt(checkpoint_path)[source]ïƒ

Load the checkpoint of the latent image space.

Parameters:
